etymology.description: 中(中) (zhōng, "middle; central") and 山(山) (shān, "mountain") combine to refer to a "central mountain". The word "Zhongshan" commonly refers to Sun Yat-sen, the founding father of the Republic of China, as he was also known by this name.
etymology.interpretation: In addition to referring to a central mountain, Zhongshan is widely recognized as the alter name of Sun Yat-sen, emphasizing his central role in Chinese history as a leader. The usage of 'mountain' in names can convey importance and stability.

examples.chinese: 中山在中国历史上具有重要地位(中山在中國歷史上具有重要地位)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngshān zài Zhōngguó lìshǐ shàng jùyǒu zhòngyào dìwèi.
examples.english: Zhongshan holds an important position in Chinese history.

examples.chinese: 中国许多地方以中山命名(中國許多地方以中山命名)，以纪念国父孙中山(以紀念國父孫中山)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó xǔduō dìfāng yǐ Zhōngshān mìngmíng, yǐ jìniàn guófù Sūn Zhōngshān.
examples.english: Many places in China are named Zhongshan to commemorate the national father, Sun Yat-sen.
